result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Buri

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
[ma] no record made, Atty Burris agrees to re-set preliminary hearing with co-defendants.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF14, 22CF12, 22CF13 called together at 4:09 PM 
Defendant Amanda L Buri in court.  Attorney Richard S Burris in court for Amanda L Buri.  
Defendant Timothy Gallitz in court. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court for Timothy Gallitz
Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld in court. 
Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Schuld indicates that he still wishes to have counsel appointed. 

No objection to an adjournment by ADA Beck.

The Court appoints an attorney to Mr. Schuld's case at no cost to the Defendant. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 4:14pm 
NEXT: (1)Appoint Counsel for Mr. Schuld (2)As to ALL Cases, Preliminary Hearing on 10/20/22 at 9:00am

[ml] Case called at 2:41PM
Defendant Amanda L Buri in court, without counsel. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court advises the Defendant that the Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed counsel for the Defendant.
Upon Court inquiry, the Defendant advises that she wants to proceed with counsel.
The Court sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel hearing.

recess 2:44PM

from Defendant re: bond and missed appearance

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Buri
Current: N1531 Joyce Rd, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 838 E Elmwood Ave, Beloit, WI 53511

[MK] case called at 1:37pm
Defendant Amanda L Buri appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel; outside counsel will need to be appointed).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Rumpf provides an updated address for Ms. Buri on Joyce Road in Fort Atkinson. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact whatsoever with the Co-Defendant Andrew Louis Schuld
--no discussion of the case with Co-Defendant Timothy J. Gallitz  
--no contact with Margaret Gordon 
--no possession or ingestion of illegal or non-prescribed controlled substances 
recess 1:43pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel because the PD needs to appoint outside counsel) on May 6th at 2:30pm [JA- note in comments that case is at prelim stage]
Extradition Forecast

[MK] case calledat 8:52am. 
Defendant Amanda L Buri not in court.  ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today.  
ADA Michaels provides information on the DA's Office multiple mailings to different addresses. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court issues a Probable Cause Warrant--body only.  
recess 8:53am
Per Judicial Rotation Order - co-actor with pending
